alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Broward County through 500 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley to 12 miles southeast of Miccosukee Service Plaza. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.
